DOCNAME: CASE OF MIHAI TOMA v. ROMANIA
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 7 - No punishment without law (Article 7-1 - Retroactivity);Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was stopped by police for drinkdriving . The police informed him on the spot that his right to drive on the public roads was suspended for DATE . The driving licence was not physically removed from the applicant ’s possession .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was stopped by police while driving a car and was committed to trial for the offence of driving on public roads while his driving licence was suspended under LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on driving on public roads ( “ Decree no . CARDINAL ” ) .

CARDINAL . In a decision of CARDINAL DATE the NORP - Jiu ORG convicted the applicant of that offence and imposed on him a criminal fine of CARDINAL NORP lei ( ROL ) and ordered him to pay ROL MONEY in costs . It also informed the applicant that if he did not comply with the payment order the fine could be converted into a prison sentence ( Article CARDINAL of LAW ) . The decision became final , as the parties did not appeal against it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went to FAC police station to ask for his old driving licence to be replaced with the new model , in accordance with the new requirements in the matter . On this occasion , the police withdrew his driving licence and informed him that it would be annulled , as the applicant had been stopped for drink - driving in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police informed the applicant that LAW CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( b ) of Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL his driving licence had been annulled with effect from DATE . His objection to the annulment was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed before ORG , seeking the revocation of the annulment order .
CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE ORG ) allowed the action for the following reasons :

“ Indeed , in the judgment of DATE of the Târgu - Jiu County Court ... the [ applicant ] was sentenced to pay a fine of ROL CARDINAL,CARDINAL ... and under Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL , the driving licence stood to be annulled if the driver was convicted of a traffic offence ...

Under LAW ) of LAW , the enforcement of the criminal fine becomes statute - barred after DATE ; therefore the annulment of the driving licence , being a subsidiary penalty ( pedeapsa accesorie ) , becomes statutebarred at the same time as the main penalty .
The time - limits are counted from the date when the events occurred , therefore ... the penalty is at present statute - barred . ”
CARDINAL . The Gorj County Police appealed , and in a final decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG ) reversed the judgment and dismissed the applicant ’s initial action , giving the following grounds :

“ The annulment of the driving licence is not a subsidiary penalty , as the firstinstance court wrongly considered ; it represents an administrative measure with distinct rules applicable to it that can only be imposed by the police .

Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL do not provide a timelimit for the application of this measure ; moreover , in the applicant ’s case the measure is applied automatically , as he was criminally convicted for a traffic offence . ”

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of Decree no . CARDINAL on driving on public roads criminalises the offence of driving on public roads with a suspended driving licence . The same LAW provides that a driving licence may be annulled if its owner has been convicted of a criminal offence under the regulations on driving on public roads ( LAW ) . The annulment is decided by the Head of ORG once the criminal decision is final ( Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Decree no . CARDINAL was abolished by Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL , which entered into force on DATE , and which in its LAW CARDINAL ( b ) made the annulment of the driving licence automatic . This Act was amended on several occasions , but the relevant provision was in place on the date when the final decision was rendered in the case at hand .
